titles.title: New York/New Jersey High-Intensity Drug Trafficking Area Expansion Act of 2008
A bill to designate 4 counties in the State of New York as high-intensity drug trafficking areas, and to authorize funding for drug control activities in those areas.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: 9/25/2008--Introduced. New York/New Jersey High-Intensity Drug Trafficking Area Expansion Act of 2008 - Designates the counties of Clinton, Franklin, Jefferson, and St. Lawrence in the state of New York as high-intensity drug trafficking areas and incorporates such counties into the New York/New Jersey high-intensity drug trafficking area program administered by the Office of National Drug Control Policy.
